info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 19 at 7:29AM CDT until April 19 at 9:45AM CDT by NWS Springfield MO
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following counties, Barry, Christian, Lawrence and Stone.
* WHEN...Until 945 AM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 729 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... Rockhouse Creek at Farm Road 2145, Flat Creek at Highway U, Swan Creek at Swan Cave Road, Flat Creek at Highway C, Finley River at Johns Ford Road, Woods Fork at Woods Fork Road and Bull Creek at Center Road. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Springfield, Nixa, Ozark, Cassville, Kimberling City, Highlandville, Clever, Sparta, Crane, Purdy, Reeds Spring, Seligman, Exeter, Galena, Washburn, Shell Knob, Fremont Hills, Butterfield, Mccord Bend, Golden, Emerald Beach, Eagle Rock, Hurley, Spokane, Chain-O-Lakes, Arrow Point, Elsey, Cape Fair, Wheelerville, Jenkins, Madry, Ponce de Leon, Mcdowell, Boaz, Selmore, Christian Center, Wayne, Linden, Chadwick and Oldfield. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 AM CDT THIS MORNING

area.areaDesc: Barry, MO; Christian, MO; Lawrence, MO; Stone, MO
